analysis_results.food_name: chopped fresh cilantro (or similar fresh herb)
major_uncertainties: Could be a fresh herb (cilantro/parsley) which is very low in calories versus a prepared green chutney/sauce that may contain oil, nuts, or sugar and be much higher in calories.
Could be chopped green onions/scallions (still low cal) rather than cilantro — small calorie difference but affects precise estimate.
Portion volume (0.171 L) is relatively large for just herbs; it might be a condiment with denser ingredients increasing calories.
analysis_results.most_important_question: Is this chopped fresh herb (like cilantro/parsley) or a prepared green chutney/sauce?

analysis_results.food_name: chicken in brown/red sauce (likely grilled/baked chicken fillet)
major_uncertainties: This could instead be paneer or tofu rather than chicken; paneer is much higher in calories than tofu and somewhat different from chicken.
The sauce type is unclear — it could be a cream- or oil-rich gravy (much higher calories) versus a tomato-based or light glaze (lower calories).
analysis_results.most_important_question: Is this item chicken (meat) or a vegetarian protein like paneer or tofu?

major_uncertainties: This could be riced cauliflower instead of actual cooked rice — cauliflower rice has far fewer calories (~25 kcal/100g) vs cooked white rice (~120-130 kcal/100g).
The rice might have been cooked/served with added fat (butter/oil) which would substantially increase calories compared with plain steamed rice.
Possibility of a rice mix (e.g., rice + grains or sticky/glutinous rice) that changes density and calories per volume.
analysis_results.most_important_question: Is the highlighted item plain cooked white rice (not riced cauliflower)?

major_uncertainties: Whether the cabbage is dressed in a creamy mayonnaise-based coleslaw (greatly increases calories) or is a vinegar-based/pickled slaw (much lower calories).
Whether it is raw shredded cabbage or cooked/braised with added sugar and oil (cooked preparations can add substantial calories).
Possible confusion with other purple vegetable salads (e.g., beet-based salad) though visual appearance favors red cabbage; if it were beetroot, caloric profile and density could differ.
analysis_results.most_important_question: Is this shredded purple/red cabbage served as a creamy mayonnaise-based coleslaw, or is it a plain/vinegar-based/pickled cabbage (not creamy)?
